item_title: ATTENTION: SEPTEMBER MEETING LOCATION CHANGE. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS IS A REVISED NOTICE THAT SUPERSEDES AND REPLACES THE PREVIOUS NOTICE. Due to the Smith River Complex Fires in Northern California, the Coastal Commission’s meeting venue has changed to the Humboldt County Board of Supervisors Chambers located in Eureka, CA.
CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: Status report and possible action on pending legislation. (KH/SD-SF)

subitem_title: Informational Presentation on 2023-24 El Niño Event
subitem_blurb: Overview of the emerging 2023-24 El Niño, potential consequences for the California coast, available information resources, and recommended preparatory measures. (JS/JS-SF)

subitem_title: LCP Grant Program
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and possible Commission action on a recommended grant award to the County of Santa Cruz under the Commission’s LCP Local Assistance Grant Program. (CB-SF)

subitem_title: Public Education Grant Program
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed awarding of targeted WHALE TAIL grants. (AKF – SF)

subitem_title: 2024 Meeting Schedule
subitem_blurb: Discussion and possible action on 2024 meeting schedule. (KH/VM-SF)

item_title: Consent Cease and Desist Order No. CCC-23-CD-04 (LHO Mission Bay Hotel L.P., San Diego)
item_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed administrative order directing and authorizing lessees of City-held lands in Mission Bay to: 1) remove unpermitted development located on leased City-owned lands, including dumpsters and other obstructions to public parking areas required by a Coastal Development Permit, 2) address civil liabilities, including by providing additional public access amenities on the property, and 3) cease and desist from undertaking additional unpermitted development at 1404 Vacation Road, City of San Diego (Paradise Point Resort) (RM-SF)

item_title: Consent Administrative Penalty No. CCC-23-AP-03 (LHO Mission Bay Hotel L.P., San Diego)
item_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed imposition of administrative penalties, requiring the lessees of City-held lands in Mission Bay to pay penalties and fund in lieu projects for resolution of penalties for violations of the public access provisions of the Coastal Act at that site, which, if unpaid, could result in the recordation of a lien on the property at 1404 Vacation Road, City of San Diego (Paradise Point Resort) (RM-SF)

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.
subitem_title: Informational Update on Caltrans Highway 101 Last Chance Grade Permanent Restoration Project.
subitem_blurb: Informational update by Caltrans on the status of the upcoming Last Chance Grade Permanent Restoration Project involving alternatives that include, but are not limited to, reengineering the existing roadway, constructing a series of retaining walls, and/or constructing a 10,000-ft.-long tunnel along 3.5-mile-long section of U.S. Highway 101 in Del Norte County (post mile 12.0 to 15.5) within Redwood National and State Parks from about 9 miles south of Crescent City to 6.5 miles north of Klamath.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-TRN-20-0069 (City of Trinidad, Trinidad)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Kimberly Tays of decision of City of Trinidad granting permit with conditions to City of Trinidad to authorize past and continued temporary closure of Van Wycke Trail for up to six months due to unsafe conditions, Trinidad, Humboldt County. (TLG-A)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-FTB-23-0021 (Best Development Group, LLC, Fort Bragg)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Fort Bragg Local Business Matters, Leslie Kashiwada, Lee Rider, and Mitzi Rider of decision of City of Fort Bragg granting permit with conditions to Best Development Group, LLC to construct Grocery Outlet Market including (1) demolish existing 16,436-sq.ft. vacant former office building and 47-space parking lot, and (2) construct 16,157-sq.ft. one-story retail store with 54-space parking lot and associated improvements and infrastructure at 825, 845, and 851 S. Franklin St., Fort Bragg, Mendocino County. (TRG-A)

subitem_title: Application No. 1-22-0621 (Kane, Humboldt County)
subitem_blurb: Application of Donald & Coral Kane to construct 2-story, 3-bedroom ~3,000-sq.ft. single family residence with associated decks, porches, 1,000-sq-ft barn, and onsite wastewater treatment system, convert test well to production well, and less than 50 cubic yards of grading at 605 Big Lagoon Ranch Road, 13 miles north of Trinidad, Humboldt County. (CM-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 1-23-0136 (Sequoia Forest Products LLC, Eureka)
subitem_blurb: Application of Sequoia Forest Products LLC to improve certain structures and demolish certain structures at former California Redwood Company Brainard Remanufacturing facility and authorize new sawmill facility that will process primarily redwood logs into lumber products at 5151 Highway 101, Eureka, Humboldt County. (TLG-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s San Francisco office at (415) 904-5260.

subitem_title: Marin County LCP Amendment No. LCP-2-MAR-23-0028-1 (Technical Edits).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by Marin County to revise the LCP to improve readability and organization, and to make minor changes and correct minor errors, is de minimis and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (HM-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. 2-22-0726 (Surfer’s Beach Sand Restoration Project, Pillar Point Harbor)
subitem_blurb: Application of the San Mateo County Harbor District for sand replenishment along approximately 1,000 ft. of eroded shoreline at Surfer’s Beach using sandy material dredged from the adjacent Pillar Point Harbor, and establishment of new eelgrass beds within the Harbor’s west basin, all at and adjacent to Pillar Point Harbor in unincorporated San Mateo County and the City of Half Moon Bay. (EM-SR)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: Santa Cruz County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SCO-23-0004-1-Part B (Sustainability Update) Time Extension Only.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on extension of time limit to act on request by Santa Cruz County to update its LCP to facilitate urban infill housing, to update allowable land uses in various zoning districts, and other related changes. (NC-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Carmel-by-the-Sea LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-CML-23-0022-1-Part B (Timeshare Provisions) Time Extension Only.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on extension of time limit to act on request by City of Carmel-by-the-Sea to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to clarify timeshare provisions. (MF-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

item_title: Items 18a thru 18c below will share a combined staff report and combined hearing

subitem_title: Application No. 3-18-0720 (3006 Pleasure Point Drive Armoring & Access Improvements, Santa Cruz Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of Michael Candau to recognize gravity wall and two seacave plugs previously constructed (initially authorized temporarily by ECDPs G-3-16-0017 and G-3-19-0032), construct minimum 4-ft.-wide coastal access path, complete seawall finish work, remove errant armoring/debris, and address violations, all as part of a continuous and integrated armoring and public accessway project spanning the bluffs seaward of residences at 3000, 3006, and 3020 Pleasure Point Drive, on bluffs seaward of residence at 3006 Pleasure Point Drive in the unincorporated Live Oak area of Santa Cruz County. (Note that the Commission's enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and/or this site, as is explained further in the staff report). (RG-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. 3-20-0166 (3020 Pleasure Point Drive Armoring & Access Improvements, Santa Cruz Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of Wavefarer Partners, LLC to recognize seacave plug previously constructed (initially authorized temporarily by ECDP G-3-22-0016), and construct shotcrete seawall with minimum 4- to 6.5-ft.-wide coastal access path,  beach/ocean access stairway,  native landscaping planting area,  bench, and associated public access improvements, all as part of  continuous and integrated armoring and public accessway project spanning bluffs seaward of residences at 3000, 3006, and 3020 Pleasure Point Drive, on bluffs seaward of residence at 3020 Pleasure Point Drive in unincorporated Live Oak area of Santa Cruz County. (RG-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. 3-22-0440 (3000 Pleasure Point Drive Armoring & Access Improvements, Santa Cruz Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of Debbie and Frank Casanova to construct upper bluff sloping soil nail wall,  vertical secant pile wall,  minimum 4-ft.-wide cantilevered coastal access path and associated public access improvements, all as part of  continuous and integrated armoring and public accessway project spanning  bluffs seaward of residences at 3000, 3006, and 3020 Pleasure Point Drive, on bluffs seaward of residence at 3000 Pleasure Point Drive in unincorporated Live Oak area of Santa Cruz County. (RG-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. 3-23-0176 (Moss Landing Wildlife Area Public Access and Habitat Improvements, Moss Landing)
subitem_blurb: Application by the California Department of Fish and Wildlife to implement a habitat resiliency and public access improvement project, including nature-based erosion control measures and a new setback levee, to protect snowy plover habitat in the Moss Landing Wildlife Area adjacent to Elkhorn Slough in the Moss Landing area of northern Monterey County. (BA-SC)

item_blurb: At a convenient time during the meeting, the Commission (CCC) will have a closed session to discuss items of pending litigation, including:

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0751 (Manly, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of John Manly to remove 400 sq.ft. floating dock and replace with 392 sq.ft. floating dock. Two (2) existing 12-in. square piles will be relocated to support new floating dock; existing 3 ft. x 24 ft. (72 sq.ft.) gangway will be relocated; existing cantilevered deck will remain in place, at 412 evening Star Lane, Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-1030 (Antepara, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Paul Antepara to remove 748 sq.ft. floating dock system and install new 433 sq.ft. floating dock supported by three (3) 14-in. square concrete piles, 72 sq.ft. gangway, and 172 sq.ft. pier supported by three (3) 14-in. square concrete piles, at 604 Via Lido Nord, Newport Beach, Orange County. (KT-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0296 (Barney, Sunset Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Christian Barney to demolish 2,142 sq.ft., 2-story detached duplex unit and construct new 2,837 sq.ft., 3-story unit with attached 697 sq.ft. garage and 960 sq.ft. roof top deck. No work is proposed to second detached duplex unit on site at 16474 24th Street, Sunset Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.
subitem_title: Poseidon Carlsbad Desalination Mitigation Program.
subitem_blurb: Review and possible Commission action on the proposed one-year 2023-2024 Work Plan and Budget for technical oversight and independent monitoring under the Poseidon Carlsbad Desalination mitigation program required as a condition of Permit No. E-06-013 (Poseidon Resources (Channelside) LP), San Diego County. (AB-SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP-5-NPB-23-0020-2 (Fractional Ownership) Time Extension Only.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend time limits for action for one year on City of Newport Beach’s request to amend the certified Implementation Plan of the City’s Local Coastal Program to clarify that Fractional Ownership uses are defined as a Time Share Use within the City of Newport Beach; and minor cleanup revision to existing timeshare regulations. (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-22-0021-2.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action request by City of Laguna Beach to amend the Implementation Plan (IP) portion of the City’s certified Local Coastal Program (LCP) zoning code Chapters 25.18, 25.19, 25.20, 25.21, 25.25, 25.28, and 25.32 relating to building height allowances for commercial structures providing subterranean parking facilities; proposed LCP amendment would allow subterranean garages designed with access ramp outside of building footprint to be exempt from applicable building height measurements similar to subterranean garages with access ramps beginning its descent within ground floor building footprint in Laguna Beach, Orange County. (BW-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-LGB-20-0058 (32007 Coast Hwy, LLC, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Mark and Sharon Fudge from City of Laguna Beach granting permit with conditions to 32007 Coast Hwy, LLC for permanent authorization of slope repair activities approved under Emergency CDP No. G-5-19-0011, including: 1) 525 cu. yd. of grading; 2) construction of soil berm; 3) various soil benching, grading, and terracing; 4) subdrains and temporary wood-lagging wall; project also includes after-the-fact approval for shoring wall with 7 caissons ranging from 30 ft. to 35 ft. in depth at 32007 Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (AS-LB)  Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-LGB-20-0059 (32005 Coast Hwy, LLC, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Mark and Sharon Fudge from City of Laguna Beach granting permit with conditions to 32005 Coast Hwy, LLC for permanent authorization of slope repair activities approved under Emergency CDP No. G-5-19-0011, including: 1) 525 cu. yds. of grading; 2) construction of soil berm; 3) various soil benching, grading, and terracing; 4) subdrains and temporary wood-lagging wall; project also includes after-the-fact approval for shoring wall with 7 caissons ranging from 30 ft. to 35 ft. in depth, after-the-fact approval for beach-access staircase associated with existing single-family home, and new shotcrete retaining wall at 32005 Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (AS-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

item_title: Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.

subitem_title: Application 5-18-0930 (Graham Property Management, LLC, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of Graham Property Management, LLC (on remand from judicial settlement) to construct new 3-level, 25-ft. tall above natural grade, 4,983 sq. ft. single-family home, 1,067 sq. ft. garage, 1,931 sq. ft. terrace/deck areas, 2,150 cu. yds. cut and 300 cu. yds. fill for construction of semi-subterranean level, 25 caissons for stabilization of building pad area, retaining wall/radiant heat barrier wall surrounding development, new cul-de-sac/fire truck turnaround with driveway cut-out, install new fire hydrant at cul-de-sac, drainage improvements, new landscaping and restoration of native vegetation on vacant 34,784 sq. ft. coastal canyon lot at 217 Vista Marina, San Clemente, Orange County. (LR-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0804 (Surf City Partners, LLC, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Surf City Partners LLC to convert vacant, former bait, tackle, & sundries shop on Huntington Beach pier to restaurant, project to include additions to existing building that formerly housed the bait, tackle & sundries shop as well as to existing public restroom building on pier. All additions are to serve the restaurant; project will result in 1,506 sq.ft. of encroachment into public pier area to accommodate restaurant; also proposed is placement of three, 32 sq.ft. vending carts on pier, at 21 and 22 Main St. (located on the pier), Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0023-1 (2020 Code Update).
subitem_blurb: Commission action on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program with the 2020 update to various chapters of the Land Development Code consisting of a variety of changes and corrections. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0025-1 (2021 Code Update).
subitem_blurb: Commission action on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program with the 2021 update to various chapters of the Land Development Code consisting of a variety of changes and corrections. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-23-0027-2 (Housing Action Plan) Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program with the Housing Package to incorporate Senate Bill 9 and other housing ordinances into the Land Development Code (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Imperial Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-IMB-23-0016-1 (9th Street Improvements) Concurrence
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Imperial Beach to amend its Local Coastal Program Land Use Plan to redesignate 9th Street from Calla Avenue to Palm Avenue from a 3 Lane Collector to a 2 Lane Collector, and redesignate 9th Street from Palm Avenue to the southern terminus of 9th Street from a 4 Lane Collector to a 3 Lane Collector, is de minimis. (CJ-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-6-IMB-23-0026 (Buckeye Investments, Inc., Imperial Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Larry Zajonc from decision of City of Imperial Beach granting permit with conditions to Buckeye Investments, Inc. for demolition of 1,625 sq. ft. commercial structure and two detached residential duplexes, and construction of new, 3-story, 34 ft. high mixed-use development with 8 residential condominiums and 2,700 sq.ft. of ground-floor commercial space on existing 10,608 sq. ft. lot at 757 Seacoast Drive, Imperial Beach, San Diego County. (CJ-SD)

subitem_title: Permit No. 6-22-0113-A1 (San Diego Point La Jolla Seasonal Closure, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Request by City of San Diego to amend permit for closure of Point La Jolla during sea lion pupping season to extend the closure year-round and install permanent gate at top of access stairs at Point La Jolla, La Jolla, San Diego, San Diego County (ML-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-22-0597 (Crest Canyon Storm Drain Replacement, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of San Diego to replace existing aluminum storm-drain pipe with concrete pipe as follow-up to emergency action, at Crest Canyon Park, North City, San Diego, San Diego County. (TR-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: University of California Santa Barbara Notice of Impending Development No. UCS-NOID-0002-23 (Baseball Stadium Turf).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on Notice of Impending Development by University of California Santa Barbara for removal of approximately three (3) acres of natural turf, in-kind replacement with artificial turf, removal and in-kind replacement of concrete dugouts, and upgrades to on-site drainage systems at Caesar Uyesaka Baseball Stadium at University of California Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara County. (SF-V)

subitem_title: University of California Santa Barbara Notice of Impending Development No. UCS-NOID-0003-23 (NCOS Prescribed Burn).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on Notice of Impending Development by the University of California Santa Barbara for 14.2-acre prescribed burn and associated firebreaks to reduce non-native grasses and support native vegetation within North Campus Open Space area at University of California Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara County. (SF-V)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: City of Malibu LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-MAL-22-0043-1 (MMHS Campus Specific Plan).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on City of Malibu’s request to amend the Land Use Plan and Local Implementation Plan of its certified LCP to incorporate new overlay district with special development standards for  redevelopment of Malibu Middle and High School Campus. (DG-V)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-MAL-23-0025 (Haagen, Malibu).
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Commissioners Brownsey and Harmon, 180 PCH, LLC, and Mountains Recreation & Conservation Authority of decision by City of Malibu granting permit with conditions to Charals Haagen for construction of new 6,567 sq.ft., one-story, single-family home with 1,723 sq.ft. basement, deck, 1,375 sq.ft. detached garage, 720 sq.ft. detached second unit with 466 sq.ft. deck, 7,194 sq.ft. tennis court with fencing and  412 sq.ft. tennis cabana, retaining walls, pool, spa, landscaping, 7,098 cu. yds. grading (4,451 cu. yds. cut, 2,647 cu. yds. fill), new on-site wastewater treatment system, and demolition of unpermitted driveway, chain-link gates and fences, removal of non-native vegetation and trees, at 33650 Pacific Coast Highway, in the City of Malibu, Los Angeles County. (DC-V) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 4-22-0554 (Los Angeles County Department of Beaches and Harbors, Malibu)
subitem_blurb: Application of the Los Angeles County Department of Beaches and Harbors to construct 10 approx. 15 ft. high, 20 ft. wide, 215-300 ft. long seasonal sand berms to protect adjacent public beach facilities from winter storm inundation, at Zuma County Beach, City of Malibu, Los Angeles County. (JH-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-VEN-23-0015 (Robert Assil, Quartz Hill, LLC, Venice)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Citizens Preserving Venice (Richard Stanger), Ernestine Elster, Julian Sy, Carol Muchin, Ger Jones, Lizzie Jones, Evelyn Tickle, David Turnbull, Mark Levy, Jonathan Sherin, Michael Gervais, Alison Crawford Gervais, and Barbara Bills from City of Los Angeles West Los Angeles Planning Commission decision granting permit with conditions to Robert Assil, Quartz Hill, LLC for the remodel and addition to a 4,056 sq.ft., 22-ft. 2 in. high, four-unit apartment building with a partial second story and two two-car garages resulting in a 5,962 sq.ft., 2-story, 28-ft. high, 4-unit apartment building with mezzanine level, rooftop deck and 4 two-car garages for total of 8 parking spaces, at 15 W. Westwind Street, Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (BW-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)
